data.text: @HealthAllegheny So does that mean the majority, or 49%, were people who were fully vaccinated?

@HealthAllegheny Jan 11 report was 23,459
Jan 18 report was 22,326
Jan 25 report was 11,821
Feb 1 report was 10,455
Feb 8 report was 3,850
Feb 15 report was 2,638
Feb 22 report was 2,105
Mar 1 report was 1,247
@HealthAllegheny @dave_andersen @wprdc @KKadonsky keep on the look out for this dashboard.
@HealthAllegheny I just wanted to say I am so excited and pleased that you are doing this--much more excited than I ever thought I would be about wastewater!

@dave_andersen @wprdc Hi -- We are currently working with out partners to create a public dashboard of wastewater testing. We hope to have it live in the next couple weeks, and will announce when it's read to go.

Sewage samples from all wastewater facilities show a decreasing trend of 7-day moving average of viral counts since mid-January. The rate of decrease is slowing. Omicron remains the dominant variant (>95%) in all facilities with a small percentage of delta as well.

There were 35 deaths reported in that same time frame.

To date, there have been 260,644 infections, 3,122 deaths and 12,955 hospitalizations reported in Allegheny County residents. For more detail on infections, hospitalizations and deaths, visit https://t.co/8iZNA5dcpr
